question_text: Which topic is central to FR 201?
option_a: Revenue officers are responsible to Accounting Officers, and approved accounting codes govern revenue collection and custody.
option_b: Offices receiving money must display notices requiring numbered official receipts for all payments.
option_c: All receipts must be recorded with dates and numbers and official receipts pasted into the cash book.
option_d: Receipts must contain full manuscript details and cheque particulars, while licences are recorded directly in cash books.
explanation: FR 201 provides that Revenue officers are responsible to Accounting Officers, and approved accounting codes govern revenue collection and custody.

option_a: Revenue Collectors must keep daily cash books and pay collections regularly using prescribed forms.
option_b: Offices receiving money must display notices requiring numbered official receipts for all payments.
option_c: All receipts must be recorded with dates and numbers and official receipts pasted into the cash book.
option_d: Revenue Collectors must use Treasury Book 6A and cannot alter printed licence values.
explanation: FR 210 provides that All receipts must be recorded with dates and numbers and official receipts pasted into the cash book.

question_text: Which top-level risk does FR 210 address?
option_a: All receipts must be recorded with dates and numbers and official receipts pasted into the cash book.
option_b: Sub-Accounting Officers and Revenue Collectors must issue stamped official receipts and cannot use temporary or private receipts.
option_c: Revenue Collectors must keep daily cash books and pay collections regularly using prescribed forms.
option_d: Revenue officers are responsible to Accounting Officers, and approved accounting codes govern revenue collection and custody.
explanation: FR 210 provides that All receipts must be recorded with dates and numbers and official receipts pasted into the cash book.
